Ad Text:
About Us

From humble beginnings in 2011, Evolution Mining is now a leading gold producer, operating six mines across Australia and Canada. Enacting our vision to be inspired people creating a premier global gold company, we are indeed a bold team with a bright future. Our operational diversity offers our employees access to many experiences and career opportunities within the one company. So, whether you choose to work at one of our underground or open pit operations, explore for our future as part of our Discovery team, or join our Group Office, we know you'll have a bright future with us.

At our Group Office

Working in our Group Office, you have a front row seat to our vision and are a part of the bold, inspired teams who are engineering its success. We're an agile, entrepreneurial company and we value smart people and creative thinking. When you work with us, you'll always have the opportunity to progress from where you started. Based in the Sydney CBD, our people work with teams located across Australia and Canada which makes for interesting work and countless ways to learn and grow.

Your Benefits

At Evolution, we support, develop and reward everyone who chooses to be a part of our bright future. Your benefits include relocation support assistance, novated car leasing, life insurance and income protection, short term incentives, referral bonuses, recognition program, study assistance, discounted health insurance and wellness days. 

This role will work a 5/2 roster from the Sydney office with some flexibility to WFH Fridays.

We understand that flexible work means something different to everyone and encourage you to have a conversation about the flexible work options available.

About the Role

The Business Partner Planning and Analysis is a high‑profile position within our finance function where your analysis genuinely shapes business decisions. Reporting to the Group Manager Financial Planning and Analysis, you will sit at the centre of our planning rhythms, partnering across sites, corporate teams and senior leadership.

You will support the full planning cycle including long‑term planning, annual budgets, and intra‑year reforecasts. Your work, drawing on at least 2 years mining and resources experience, will help guide performance expectations for the market, including analysis that informs leadership and supports ASX guidance. You will also play a hands‑on role in future system upgrades as we evaluate and implement a new planning tool for the Group. This is an opportunity to help modernise how we plan, forecast and report across the entire organisation.

Alongside the technical work, this role takes a business partnering approach: spotting trends early, challenging assumptions, and supporting teams to manage headcount, contractor spend and performance outcomes.

In this role, you will:

Prepare and consolidate operational submissions and present insights to the CFO and senior leaders
Build and maintain models, scenario analysis and capital tracking to support decision making
Contribute to the design and rollout of our new planning system, working closely with IT and key stakeholders

This is a job for someone who enjoys variety, wants influence, and thrives on the mix of deep analysis, collaboration and business engagement.

About You

You are a motivated finance professional who enjoys digging into the numbers and turning them into something meaningful. You understand how operational decisions flow through to financial outcomes and you're comfortable working under time pressure without compromising accuracy. You have enough experience in mining, resources or related industries to understand the rhythm of production and cost drivers, and you're curious enough to keep asking "why" until the story behind the data is clear.

You are confident engaging with senior stakeholders and not afraid to present your work. You like being part of system and process improvements and are keen to shape how planning is done across the business. You enjoy being coached and given responsibility and you bring a steady, solutions‑focused approach when things move quickly or change direction.

You'll bring:

Experience in FP&A, commercial analysis or management accounting, ideally with exposure to budgeting, forecasting and modelling
Strong analytical capability and advanced skills in Excel and financial modelling
Experience with planning systems or ERP platforms and an interest in transformation or system uplift
Tertiary qualifications in finance, commerce or a related field (CA or CPA desirable)

Most importantly, you're driven by impact. You want to partner with the business, contribute to meaningful change and grow your career in a role where your work is seen, valued and acted on.

Closing

At Evolution, as our name suggests, change and transformation is in our DNA. We want the Evolution experience to be your career highlight. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a more inclusive and diverse workforce that represents the communities in which we operate. We provide a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all and candidates from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply. We are focused on keeping our people safe and healthy and creating sustainable value in an environmentally and socially responsible way. Join our bold team to start your next exciting chapter.

To Apply

To apply, please email evolutionmining.com/careers/

We thank you for taking the time to submit your application.

We’re partnering with a leading financial services organisation to recruit a Senior Manager – Liquidity Stress Testing, sitting within a central Group Treasury function responsible for balance sheet efficiency, resilience and liquidity risk management.

This role is ideal for someone with a strong understanding of bank liquidity under both normal and stressed conditions, who enjoys combining analytics, modelling and senior stakeholder engagement. You’ll lead liquidity stress testing capability, support funding and liquidity strategy, and manage a team delivering high-impact insights to senior leadership.

What you’ll be doing
Support Group Treasury in managing the Group’s balance sheet, including liquidity optimisation and funding strategy forecasting.
Lead the development and execution of liquidity stress testing models across a range of scenarios.
Deliver scenario analysis and forward-looking insights on liquidity resilience.
Drive continuous improvement in liquidity stress testing methodologies, analytics and reporting.
Prepare high-quality papers, dashboards and presentations for senior executives and committees.
Partner closely with stakeholders across Business Units, Finance and Risk.
Lead, mentor and develop a team of Analysts and Senior Analysts, fostering a strong, collaborative culture.
What we’re looking for
Tertiary qualifications in finance, accounting, economics, engineering or a related discipline.
Experience in liquidity risk, liquidity stress testing, balance sheet analytics or treasury-related modelling.
Strong data and analytics capability, with hands-on experience using SQL, Python and/or R.
Solid understanding of the Australian prudential framework (APS 210 highly regarded).
Proven ability to deliver high-quality outcomes under pressure in complex environments.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills, with confidence operating at senior levels.
A clear risk mindset and comfort working in highly regulated settings.
If you’d like to discuss the role confidentially, feel free to get in touch.

We’re partnering with a major financial services organisation to recruit a Senior Manager – Group Stress Testing, sitting within a central Group Treasury function focused on balance sheet resilience, capital strength, and stress testing analytics.

This is a highly visible leadership role, responsible for delivering forward-looking insights on the Group’s balance sheet, capital and profitability under a range of macroeconomic and idiosyncratic stress scenarios. You’ll lead a team of analysts, work closely with senior stakeholders across Treasury, Finance and Risk, and play a key role in regulatory stress testing and resilience frameworks.

What you’ll be doing
Lead the design, development and execution of stress testing models assessing capital, credit and profitability impacts across the Group.
Apply advanced quantitative and analytical techniques to project balance sheet and financial outcomes under stress scenarios.
Produce high-quality papers, insights and presentations for senior executives and committees.
Partner closely with Group Treasury, Finance and Risk teams to support balance sheet management and capital decision-making.
Lead, mentor and develop a team of Analysts and Senior Analysts, building a high-performance culture.
Contribute to regulatory stress testing exercises and ensure alignment with prudential requirements.
Drive continuous improvement in stress testing methodologies, processes and analytical tooling.
What we’re looking for
Strong quantitative background (e.g. mathematics, statistics, engineering, economics or similar).
Experience in stress testing, credit risk modelling (IRB and/or IFRS 9), financial modelling or balance sheet analytics.
Proficiency in data and modelling tools such as SQL, Python, R or SAS.
Solid understanding of the Australian prudential framework and APS standards.
Proven ability to operate in complex, highly regulated environments with multiple senior stakeholders.
Strong leadership, planning and delivery capability, with the confidence to challenge and influence.
If you’d like to discuss this opportunity confidentially, feel free to reach out.

About the Company

Davidson Technology are working with a large State Government agency to secure an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to support in the requirements gathering and technical design of a new Program Management dashboard.


About the Role

As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll be responsible for leading the requirements gathering and technical design of a new Program and Project Management dashboard, supporting the transition from manual, fragmented reporting to an integrated and scalable solution. You will work closely with stakeholders to capture and document business, functional, and non-functional requirements through workshops and structured analysis, while collaborating with Microsoft specialists, project teams, and the department's IT department. You'll support staged development and incremental delivery, provide technical input to prototype solutions, and ensure strong governance, accountability, and high-quality documentation, enabling improved data quality, timely reporting, and early identification of underperforming projects.


About You

To be successful in this role, you'll will bring proven experience in business intelligence and data analytics, strong stakeholder engagement and requirements elicitation capabilities to complex, multi-stakeholder environments. You will demonstrate deep expertise in Power BI, SharePoint Online, and Microsoft Dynamics/Power Automate, with a strong ability to document clear business, functional, and non-functional requirements that underpin robust technical design. With excellent communication and documentation skills, you'll provide professional oversight of reporting solutions, laying a strong foundation for scalable, staged development and future enhancements while delivering high-impact insights for major infrastructure programs.


The Benefits

You will be offered a 6-month contract (possible extension) on an excellent hourly rate and the ability to negotiate a flexible working arrangement after an initial induction period.


Please apply with current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

Seeking Senior Business Analyst with 7+ years experience  

  The Department seeks Senior Business Analysts to support a range of projects within a broader program of work in the ICT Division. The engagement of these resources is to fill immediate gaps as well as future projects identified in the forward plan of work. The successful candidate will report to the relevant Director and Project Manager and will independently apply business analysis skills to a range of projects. Our new Senior Business Analysts will:

Work with stakeholders to identify and analyse the current state and desired future state of business systems and processes.
Gather and document requirements using departmental templates
Take a user centred design approach to the development of Business Analyst artefacts.
Key duties and responsibilities
Analyse and model business processes and identify opportunities for improvement. Develop comprehensive business process models, roadmaps, and implementation plans, ensuring that proposed improvements are well-understood and communicated with stakeholders.
Collaborate with data analysts and data scientists to leverage data and analytics for process improvement and informed decision-making.
Gather and document requirements: Elicit and record the needs of stakeholders, translating them into clear specifications for development teams.
Compile and present data, reports, and recommendations to stakeholders and executives.
Create data models, process diagrams, and wireframes to visualize potential solutions, using industry standard techniques.
Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring clear communication and understanding.
Collaborating with subject matter experts, end users, product owners, change managers, architects, developers, database administrators, testers and trainers to design and deliver solutions. 
About the team The Information Management and Technology Division (IMD) within is a client service driven division, dedicated to delivering high quality, fit-for-purpose ICT solutions to global workforce. The division delivers complex, high value and high-risk ICT programs and multi-year digital transformation initiatives.

Essential criteria
1.Exceptional ability to confidently elicit and define epics, user stories & acceptance criteria following best practice principles as well as identifying and defining non-functional requirements (NFR).

2.Exceptional communication skills and ability to facilitate interviews, workshops and engage with a wide variety of stakeholders to successfully document business processes and requirements. Apply and monitor appropriate use of modelling and analysis tools, methods and standards.

3.Ability and experience in the application of user centred design principles and tools including personas, service blueprints and journey maps to ensure technology investments meet user requirements and align with business goals and strategic objectives.

4.Experience applying Business Analysis practice to Business Problems supporting solution development in an emerging technology area.

5.Seven+ years experience in a similar role.

Desirable criteria
1.A demonstrable passion for innovation and a dedication to working collaboratively building strong relationships with stakeholders, taking into account individual views and ideas and tailoring the approach.

2.Strong organisational and time management skills are needed to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines.


Contract: 12 Month Contract with 2 x 12 months extension  

Security Required: TSPV Security Clearance required

Location- Canberra based

How to Apply - Please upload your resume to apply. Candidates will need to be willing to undergo pre-employment screening checks which may include, ID and work rights, security clearance verification and any other client requested checks

Closing date:  Wednesday  25 February 2026

Call Joanne Finchett on 0480 002454 or email Joanne@whizdom.com.au for any further information

Repurpose It is a leader in the circular economy, giving waste a new life. We work with materials from construction, demolition, excavation, road and rail projects, as well as organics and timber waste. Using advanced technology and innovative processes, we turn these materials into high-quality resources while reducing greenhouse gases and environmental impact.

We partner with both public and private sectors to deliver sustainable solutions that benefit clients, communities, and the planet. At our core, our values—Integrity, Future Focused, Sustainability, and Care & Protect—guide every decision. Join us and be part of a team that cares about people, the planet, and making a real difference.

The Opportunity

We are currently looking for a hands-on Senior Financial Analyst who can turn numbers into strategy and connect financial insights with operational decision-making. This is your chance to step into a pivotal role where finance meets growth, sustainability, and innovation.

This is an onsite role based in Essendon Fields, with regular travel required to our operational sites across Melbourne (Epping, Montrose, Hallam, Cranbourne West)

In this role, you’ll:

Deliver meaningful insights that drive smarter, faster business decisions
Lead forecasting, budgeting, and financial modelling across operation
Provide strategic financial insights to guide data-driven decisions
Partner with senior leaders at Repurpose It to shape growth strategies and investment opportunities
Build business cases and provide financial guidance for new initiatives
Drive continuous improvement, process efficiency, and automation of financial operations
Build strong stakeholder relationships and act as a trusted advisor across the business
Take ownership of financial outcomes and lead key initiatives from analysis to implementation

What you’ll bring:

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or a related field
CA/CPA qualified with strong financial analysis, modelling, and reporting skills
Strong communication skills with the ability to influence and collaborate across teams
Analytical, adaptable, and passionate about improving processes and supporting growth

How to Apply:

If this sounds like you and you’d like to join our team, then we’d love to hear from you! To submit your application for the role, please hit the ‘Apply’ button and submit your cover letter and CV. For any questions, please contact careers@repurposeit.com.au

By applying for this role, you agree to Repurpose It storing your application in our Applicant Tracking System and we may reach out to you if another role becomes available that you may be suited to. All final applicants for this position will be asked to consent to a criminal record check (police check).

If you would like any adjustments to be made throughout the application process, please just let us know!

We're on the lookout for a dynamic Business Analyst who is driven by the excitement of delivering exceptional products and solutions that truly wow our customers. As a Business Analyst with us, you'll be at the heart of this mission, working closely with both internal teams and external partners to identify, gather, and transform insights into innovative business results that make an impact.

You will need to have TechnologyOne Technology experience, specifically within our Flagship 'Financials' Product Suite.

At TechnologyOne, Business Analysts are key players in shaping the future. You'll be actively involved in capturing fresh business requirements and seamlessly communicating them with our development teams. You'll play a crucial role in analysing, documenting, and refining functional and technical product needs that not only meet but exceed our customers' expectations. Join us and be part of something exciting!

What you'll be doing…


Build and deepen your expertise in the Enterprise Cash Receipting product, understanding its features, functionality, compliance requirements, and industry-specific nuances.
Collaborate closely with the Product Owner, Customers, and Development team throughout the development cycle to create user requirements, test cases, and other documentation that capture customer needs using structured design methodologies.
Contribute to the creation of new features and collaborate with the Development team to break down designs into actionable development tasks.
Engage in workshops with both internal and external Customers to ensure the product design aligns with their requirements.
Lead Business Acceptance Testing, focusing on functional tests of key business operations to ensure the product meets customer expectations and is stable enough for further testing-ensuring no critical or urgent issues remain.
Support functional QA and regression testing as needed, based on team requirements.
Partner with the Product Success team to develop enablement materials that aid in the successful rollout and adoption of the product by both internal and external users.
Participate in presentations and forums to educate stakeholders on new product features and updates.

Your Talents…


Hands-on experience and solid understanding of the Technology One Enterprise Cash Receipting module, features, functions, and compliance requirements
Understanding of the financial transaction lifecycle including reconciliation of receipts to payments highly desirable.
Experience with payment gateways and payment device management, including understanding of integrations highly desirable.
A relevant degree or equivalent industry experience.
Exceptional time management abilities, with a proven track record of effectively prioritizing tasks.
Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Proven presentation skills and experience in leading workshops and facilitating group discussions.

Role : Portfolio Analyst

Brisbane CBD based
Government sector
Long term, until December 2027
Competitive hourly rate (up to $102)
Only open to Brisbane based candidates
About the role 
An exciting opportunity for a Portfolio Reporting Analyst to support the delivery of performance reporting across a complex capital works and infrastructure portfolio within state government.
This role works closely with portfolio management, investment, and finance teams to enable accurate data‑driven insights and informed decision‑making.

In this role, you will

Contribute to the development and ongoing improvement of portfolio performance frameworks, reporting standards, and templates.
Help develop and maintain tools and standards for tracking portfolio performance.
Collect, verify, and compile data from various programs and teams to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Create reports, dashboards, and visual summaries to support internal and external stakeholders, identify risks, and opportunities for improvement.
Assist in preparing briefings and summaries for executives, including recommendations for governance.
Collaborate with stakeholders across multiple teams within the broader organization.
To succeed in this role, you should have:

Experience in managing or reporting on portfolios, programs, or investments, preferably within government.
Ability to produce high-quality reports that help guide leadership decisions.
Strong skills in data analysis and experience with tools like Power BI, Excel, and Microsoft Fabric.
Excellent ability to interpret complex data.
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal

Company: Department of Primary Industries & Regional Development
Location: Orange, Blue Mountains & Central West NSW (Hybrid)
Category:
Business/Systems Analysts (Information & Communication Technology)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Fixed term 6 month contract (with possibility of extension/ongoing employment)
Hybrid work environment on offer – location negotiable across regional NSW
Salary ranging from $129,464pa - $142,665pa + super
Create impact in your industry, using your specialist skills and experience

As an ICT Business Analyst, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of ICT services, driving impactful projects that influence decision-making and service delivery. You’ll work closely with the ICT Senior Project Officer and the ICT team to analyse business needs, design solutions, and ensure successful project outcomes. If you thrive on solving complex problems, enjoy collaborating with diverse stakeholders, and are passionate about turning business needs into effective technical solutions, we want you on our team!

About the Team
Local Land Service (LLS) is a regional-focused NSW Government agency delivering quality customer services to farmers, landholders and the wider community. We help people make better decisions about the land they manage and assist rural and regional communities to be profitable and sustainable into the future.

Your day-to-day duties:

Play a crucial role in evaluating business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and facilitating the implementation of solutions that enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and analyse data, develop insights, and provide recommendations that drive strategic decisions and operational excellence.
Multi-task and be familiar with several different intersecting projects and their respective ICT systems.
Develop and maintain process documentation, including business process models and standard operating procedures.

To be successful in this role you’ll need:

Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate business needs into clear technical requirements.
Experience in stakeholder management, process mapping, and documentation, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical users.
A background in business analysis, with a solid understanding of ICT systems and data analysis, will be essential to drive process improvements and ensure successful project outcomes.

Key knowledge and experience:

Extensive experience in technical business analysis including aid in solution development
Demonstrated experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, BI tools or similar and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience in process modelling and improvement methodologies.

Essential requirements:

A Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, Project Management, or related discipline, and/or equivalent experience
A current NSW driver licence combined with the willingness and ability to travel across NSW (including overnight stays if required) is also required.

For more information on this role, you can download the role description.

Want more information? Contact Caroline Jones | Senior Manager ICT Solutions via 0458 000 534 or caroline.a.jones@lls.nsw.gov.au.

Applying is Easy! 

To apply, please submit a copy of your resume (approx. 4 pages) and a cover letter (approx. 2 pages) that tells us about your relevant skills and experience and how these make you an ideal candidate for this role. 

What is the Process?  

The process starts with you submitting your application. Once your application has been received, you will receive an email confirmation and further correspondence when the role advertisement closes. 

You might be asked to attend an interview (either via video, over the phone or face to face) or complete a written or other assessment task.

Application Closing Date:  Sunday 1st February 2026 at 11.55pm 

Recruitment Adjustments 

If you require adjustments in completing your application, interviewing, completing any pre- employment testing, require information in an alternative format, or otherwise participating in the recruitment process, please let us know so we can assist. Send an email to talent.advisory@dpird.nsw.gov.au or contact the hiring manager listed above for a confidential discussion. 

Additional Information

A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary roles of the same role or role type that may become available for filling over the next eighteen months. 

The successful applicant in this role will be required to undergo reference checks, National Police Check, and Bankruptcy Check.

We’re looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join a high-impact POS (Point of Sale) team supporting critical in-store platforms used daily by thousands of team members nationwide. You’ll be working in a small, collaborative agile squad focused on improving the experience for both store teams and customers.

In this role, you’ll act as the bridge between business and technology — gathering, documenting and communicating requirements, facilitating workshops, and ensuring what’s delivered truly meets business needs.
What you’ll do:

Partner with stakeholders to gather and translate requirements into user stories and process maps
Facilitate workshops and help define clear acceptance criteria and delivery scope
Support development and QA teams with clarifications, analysis and ongoing alignment
Identify and manage risks, dependencies, and enhancements throughout delivery
What you’ll bring:

Proven experience as a Business Analyst within agile delivery teams
Hands-on experience writing user stories, epics and acceptance criteria
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Proficiency with JIRA and Confluence
High attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities
Why you’ll love it:
You’ll work in a down-to-earth, outcomes-driven team who value collaboration and delivery. Expect flexibility, autonomy, and the satisfaction of knowing your work directly impacts how customers are served every day.

Business Introduction GSK remains committed to achieving bold commercial ambitions for the future. By 2031, we aim to deliver £40 billion in annual sales, leveraging our existing strong performance momentum to significantly increase our positive impact on the health of billions of patients globally. Our Ahead Together strategy is centred on early intervention to prevent and alter the course of disease, thereby protecting people and supporting healthcare systems.
Our diverse portfolio consists of vaccines, specialty medicines, and general medicines.


Through continuous innovation and a dedicated focus on scientific and technical excellence, we strive to develop and launch new, groundbreaking treatments that address critical health challenges. Position Summary You will lead business insights for our Australia commercial teams.

You will turn data into clear guidance that supports planning, performance and growth. You will work closely with commercial leaders, marketing, finance and analytics peers. We value curiosity, clear communication and a practical problem-solving approach.

This role offers growth, visible impact and the chance to advance GSK’s mission of uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. Responsibilities This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career.

These responsibilities include some of the following:

Develop and maintain forecasting and demand planning models to support commercial planning and monthly cycles.
Create and manage KPI dashboards and regular performance reports for brand, marketing and sales stakeholders.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights and recommendations for non-technical audiences.
Partner with marketing and commercial teams to evaluate campaign effectiveness and optimise channel mix.
Lead ad hoc analysis to identify growth opportunities and support business case development.
Support data governance and collaborate with data providers and analytics teams to ensure data quality.

Why You? Basic Qualification We are seeking professionals with the following required skills and qualifications to help us achieve our goals

Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, statistics, economics, data science or a related field.
Minimum 3–5 years’ experience in business insights, commercial analytics, forecasting or FP&A.
Strong experience in forecasting, financial or demand modelling with proven accuracy improvements.
Advanced Excel skills and experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI, Tableau or Qlik.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Comfortable presenting to senior leaders.

Ability to translate technical analysis into simple, practical business recommendations.

Preferred Qualification If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus

Experience within pharmaceutical, healthcare or life sciences commercial teams.
Knowledge of customer and digital analytics, including web and campaign performance metrics.
Experience managing or mentoring junior analysts or small teams.
Familiarity with SQL, Python or R for data manipulation and modelling.
Experience working with cloud data platforms or enterprise BI systems.
Advanced degree or professional qualification in a relevant field.

Working Arrangement This role is hybrid, based in Australia with regular time in the office and flexibility to work from home. You will meet with stakeholders across teams and locations when required.

What we value in you You are curious, practical and focused on outcomes. You make complex information easy to understand.

You build strong working relationships. You act with integrity and respect. You are open to learning and share your knowledge to help others grow.

Apply now If this role sounds like the right next step, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your CV and a short cover note telling us how your experience matches the role and why you want to join us.

Why GSK?

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

GSK is a global biopharma company with a purpose to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. We aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of the decade, as a successful, growing company where people can thrive. We get ahead of disease by preventing and treating it with innovation in specialty medicines and vaccines.

We focus on four therapeutic areas: respiratory, immunology and inflammation; oncology; HIV; and infectious diseases – to impact health at scale.

People and patients around the world count on the medicines and vaccines we make, so we’re committed to creating an environment where our people can thrive and focus on what matters most. Our culture of being ambitious for patients, accountable for impact and doing the right thing is the foundation for how, together, we deliver for patients, shareholders and our people.

We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and providing equal opportunities for all applicants. We embrace an agile working culture across our roles, so if flexibility is important to you please discuss opportunities with our hiring team. If you need any adjustments to the recruitment process to help you demonstrate your strengths and capabilities, contact APACRecruitment.Adjustments@gsk.com.

Please note this email is for adjustment requests only; for other enquiries please use our standard contact channels.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK.

In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

About us    

Billigence Pty Ltd is a specialist in the delivery of market-leading Business Intelligence and CRM solutions. Headquartered in Sydney, Australia and with offices in Prague, Frankfurt and Singapore our passion is data and our focus is the delivery of end-to-end solutions via a talented team of skilled professionals.  
We are partners with leading edge software platforms including Tableau, Alteryx, Snowflake, DBT, Collibra, Matillion and Salesforce.

What we are looking for    

We are seeking a Data Governance consultant to join our existing team and work closely alongside leading global banking/finance organisations. 

This will be an initial 6-12 month contract with strong potential to extend. 

Essential skills/ experience required: 

4+ Years experience in a data governance
Experienced in data lineage documentation
Data quality & stewardship
Understanding of policies for data handling 
Experience with data governance tools such as Collibra, Alation, IDQ or similar
Excellent stake holder engagement experience/skills
Excellent written & verbal communication skills are essential 
  
If you fit the description and are a passionately driven individual, we would love to meet you.    

Please note, only successful candidates will be contacted. 

No recruitment agencies please

About us:

Roger Drake purchased his first supermarket in 1974, and today Drakes is the largest independent grocery retailer in Australia employing over 6,000 team members. Growing from one store to more than 60 stores across South Australia and Queensland, Drakes has retained the same values since day one.

Our mission at Drakes is to provide our customers with exceptional service, value for money, a great range and an outstanding shopping experience. To achieve this, we acknowledge that our customers are the most important people in our business.

What we offer you: 

Become a valuable part of highly supportive diverse work culture, with more than 6,000 team members nationally, we’re committed to creating an inspiring workplace at Drakes, which supports the development of great people. 

10% staff and family discount across all Drakes stores 

Wide range of corporate benefits including discounted gym memberships, banking, health insurance and much more!  

In-depth onboarding and career progression opportunities 

Company funded retail management qualifications and first aid qualifications

Vehicle leasing opportunities 

About the opportunity:

We are seeking an experienced IT Data & Integration Lead to play a pivotal role in ensuring the stability, performance, and continual evolution of Drakes’ data and integration ecosystem. Operating within a large and complex technology landscape, this role balances hands-on technical delivery with technical leadership, supporting both Business-as-Usual (BAU) operations and strategic transformation initiatives. 

You will be responsible for maintaining and optimising enterprise data platforms including SQL Server, data warehouses, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI, and a wide range of bespoke and vendor-driven integrations. At the same time, you will contribute to the modernisation and consolidation of Drakes’ data environment, supporting future readiness in areas such as cloud adoption, automation, and AI/ML enablement. 

This role works closely with IT leadership, Technical SMEs, Solutions Analysts, business stakeholders, and external partners. You will also provide day-to-day mentoring and guidance to a Technical Solutions Analyst.

Key Responsibilities: 

Ensure the reliability, performance, and availability of core data platforms and integrations 

Lead incident management, root-cause analysis, and resolution of data and integration issues 

Maintain high standards of data quality, integrity, security, and availability 

Design, configure, enhance, and optimise integrations between business-critical systems 

Deliver enhancements and minor projects that improve efficiency and support new business initiatives 

Provide technical leadership across data engineering, reporting, modelling, and integration practices 

Identify opportunities to reduce technical debt, consolidate platforms, and automate workflows

HorizonOne are excited to be partnering with Icon Water to recruit new team members into their Digital Technology Group.

About Icon Water

Wholly owned by the ACT Government, Icon Water has delivered essential services to Canberra for over 100 years. While primarily a water and sewerage provider, it also invests in electricity and gas through private partnerships, operating across both government and commercial sectors.

Icon Water is focused on sustainability, playing a key role in addressing climate change, protecting the environment, and achieving net zero emissions by 2045.

Serving approximately 190,000 customers, the business manages over $3.2 billion in assets, including dams, treatment plants, reservoirs, and networks of mains and pumps, and generates around $490 million in annual revenue.
 
The Opportunity

Icon Water is progressing through a significant digital and data transformation, making this a highly impactful time to join. This is a high-impact Cyber GRC Analyst role where your insights and work will influence strategic risk decisions, operational maturity, and critical infrastructure protection.

You will report to the Cyber GRC Lead and Manager, who regularly present to senior executive committees. This is a unique Canberra-based opportunity to build influence and capability in a values-driven environment, where you can see the real impact on the community.

Please view the candidate information page for this role here: bit.ly/H1DTGrecruitment   
 
The Role

Working across both cyber strategy and hands-on GRC execution, key responsibilities include:

Maintain cyber risk management processes
Translate policy frameworks (e.g. ISM, NIST, PSPF) into real-world implementation
Prepare and present reports to Risk & Assurance Committee every six weeks
Uplift compliance and maturity through structured improvement programs
Support internal audits, risk reviews, and framework alignment
Contribute to cyber awareness, training, and business engagement initiatives
Work closely with IT, OT and business teams to build a holistic cyber capability
Track incidents, exceptions, and risk mitigations with high attention to detail
The Ideal Person

You’re a confident and structured communicator with 5+ years’ experience in Cyber GRC, risk, or assurance, bringing strong knowledge of the ISM and cyber maturity models, as well as the ability to build trust across IT, business, and executive teams.

You have a calm, curious, and empathetic approach to stakeholder engagement, ideally with experience in critical infrastructure and certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CRISC. An understanding of utilities, energy, or other critical infrastructure environments is highly regarded.

Salary / Rate

The salary band starts at $147,800 + 15% Super. Flexible depending on experience.

In addition to an attractive remunerartion package, Icon Water offer great employee benefits including:

Flexible working arrangements
Career development opportunities
Health and wellbeing contributions
Salary sacrifice options

About us

At Healthdirect Australia we work with purpose and dedication to help Australians actively manage and improve their health.

Our virtual services are easily accessible via multiple channels, including helplines, video call solutions and websites and cater for Australians at all stages of life. No matter where people live, or what time of the day or night it is, they can use our services to talk to a health professional, find trusted information and advice online and locate their closest health service.

About the opportunity

We’re seeking a hands-on leader to drive our data science and insights practice. As the Data Scientist & Insights Team Lead, you’ll deliver production-grade forecasting and machine learning solutions, lead the design of stakeholder-facing visualisations, and turn data into actionable insights.
  
Key Responsibilities:

Build and operationalise predictive models in R/Python, ensuring robust experiment tracking and uncertainty quantification.
Lead the delivery of visualisations and insight products, translating business questions into analytics that influence decisions.
Partner with Analytical Engineering to create “gold” datasets and optimise our Qlik platform.
Manage and coach direct reports, fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration.
Represent the Insights Division in strategic projects, ensuring data science perspectives shape policy and service design.
What You’ll Bring

Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent practical experience.
Expert in SQL, Python or R, with strong data visualisation skills (Qlik scripting/set analysis preferred).
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, DataBricks) and modern transformation tools (dbt).
Proven leadership in analytics teams and end-to-end ELT/ETL workflow ownership.
Knowledge of data management, governance, and agile delivery practices.
CI/CD, version control, and automated testing experience desirable. 
Why work with us

We believe our strength comes from our talented and dedicated staff. We are committed to working together to create a culture where you can bring your whole self to work.
  
Our benefits include:

Flexible work arrangements (2 days per week in office, pro-rated for part time employees).
14 weeks company Paid Parental Leave for both parents.
Multi-dimensional wellbeing program that is run by our people for our people.
Individual curated learner journeys to support you to expand your capabilities and unlock your talent.
To find out more about Healthdirect, and our vision for a healthier Australia, please visit our website - about.healthdirect.gov.au.

About Us

K92 Mining Ltd is a publicly listed company operating the Kainantu Gold Mine in the Eastern Highlands of Papua New Guinea. We are entering a phase of significant expansion and this, coupled with a strong balance sheet and significant known deposits, makes it an exciting time to join an organisation committed to excellence in mining operations, safety, and environmental sustainability.

About the Role

Reporting to the Manager – Group IT, this position is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining enterprise-wide analytics and reporting solutions. The role supports site operations in PNG and corporate teams in Brisbane and Vancouver by delivering timely, accurate, and consistent operational and financial insights.

This position integrates data from core operational systems including Pronto, Deswik.OPS, OSI PI Historian, and Cognos, standardises KPI definitions across the business, and enables data-driven decision-making on equipment performance, people movements, supplier spend, and project delivery.

Key Accountabilities

Business Intelligence Delivery: Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards that support daily, weekly, and monthly operational and corporate decision-making.
Data Integration & Automation: Build and maintain automated data pipelines integrating Pronto, Deswik.OPS, OSI PI Historian, and Cognos into a governed reporting framework.
Data Governance & Standards: Establish and enforce consistent KPI definitions, naming conventions, data models, and visual standards across all reporting assets.
Operational Insight & Performance: Translate operational and financial data into actionable insights on equipment performance, resource utilisation, supplier spend, and delivery performance.
Stakeholder Engagement & Enablement: Partner with Operations, Finance, Projects, HSE, and IT stakeholders to understand reporting needs and drive adoption of BI tools.
Vendor & Contractor Oversight: Review and validate deliverables from external BI providers and progressively reduce reliance on third parties by building internal capability.
Cost & Efficiency Support: Provide analytical insight to support cost control, budget tracking, and identification of optimisation opportunities.
Documentation & Knowledge Management: Develop and maintain technical and user documentation for dashboards, metrics, and data models.

About You

You will be an experienced data and analytics professional with a strong technical foundation and the ability to engage effectively with operational stakeholders. You will also bring:

Qualifications:
• Tertiary or postgraduate qualifications in Data Analytics, Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
• Microsoft Power BI or relevant data visualisation certification (e.g. DA-100 / PL-300) – desirable.
• Additional certification in data engineering, governance, or cloud platforms (e.g. Azure Data Fundamentals) – desirable.

Experience:
• Minimum 5 years' experience developing and managing Power BI dashboards in a complex operational or enterprise environment.
• Strong understanding of KPI frameworks, business performance reporting, and data modelling concepts.
• Proven ability to integrate data from multiple systems such as Pronto, Deswik.OPS, OSI PI Historian, and IBM Cognos.
• Experience in DAX, Power Query (M), and advanced report design.
• Familiarity with data governance principles, including consistency of metrics, naming conventions, and report structure.
• High-level proficiency in SQL and Excel.

Desirable:
• Experience working in mining, industrial, or large-scale operational environments.
• Exposure to flight/camp logistics reporting, equipment performance metrics, or supplier cost analysis.
• Experience with Power Platform (e.g. Power Automate) or other BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik).
• Knowledge of cloud data solutions (e.g. Azure, AWS, or Snowflake).

Life at K92

Our core values — Collaboration, Accountability, Respect, Excellence, and Safety — are central to our operations and fundamental to our success. K92 upholds a commitment to equal opportunity, striving to ensure every individual can reach their highest potential without discrimination.

We believe in sharing our success with our employees. In addition to competitive remuneration, we offer access to incentive plans, wellbeing and employee assistance programs, and a supportive and professional working environment.

If you share our values and are looking for your next career step, we encourage you to join us on this exciting journey. Submit your application through our website today.

THIS POSITION IS OPEN ONLY TO CANDIDATES WHO HAVE THE RIGHT TO LIVE & WORK IN AUSTRALIA WITHOUT SPONSORSHIP

We’ve been trusted to serve Aussie communities since 1914 and grown to become a top 30-listed on the ASX with over 115,000 team members and a portfolio of iconic brands. At Coles Group, you’ll not only get to make a difference to millions of Aussie lives—you’ll also get to see your impact.

About the team

Strategy is making the future of retail a reality. We’re a big business with big ideas. Our team works together with all our business units to help bring those ideas to life. We stay focused on what’s next, so we can make our customers’ experiences even better now and lead the industry for years to come.

About the role


An opportunity exists for a dynamic Strategy Business Partner (SBP) to join our Group Strategy function. In this pivotal role, you will partner with senior stakeholders to shape and execute Coles’ strategic priorities, ensuring we remain a world class retailer. You’ll play a critical role in turning insights into action, supporting decision-making at the highest level, and driving initiatives that deliver long-term value. Your key responsibilities will include:



Deliver fact-based insights to inform business strategies, the corporate plan, and solutions to critical challenges. 
Partner with Strategy Managers and the Head of Group Strategy to design and execute Coles’ strategy. 
Apply structured problem-solving and rigorous analysis to develop initiatives and define success metrics for strategic issues. 
Act as a strategic thought partner to senior stakeholders, driving execution of key initiatives. 
Conduct high-quality quantitative and qualitative analysis to solve complex business problems. 
Synthesise findings into clear recommendations that enable effective execution. 
Take ownership of project success within your area of responsibility, ensuring timely and impactful delivery. 
Identify risks to in-scope projects and support the development of mitigation plans.


About you and your skills


You are a strategic thinker with strong analytical capabilities, able to turn complexity into clarity and influence senior stakeholders with confidence. You will bring:



Demonstrated experience in management consulting, ideally from a top-tier strategy firm (McKinsey, Bain or BCG)
Proven expertise in complex analytical problem-solving (e.g., hypothesis-based approaches). 
Advanced proficiency in financial modelling and tools such as PowerPoint and Excel. 
Experience managing work-streams within large-scale projects. 
Ability to craft and contribute to board-level presentations and reports. 
Strong communication and presentation skills with senior stakeholders. 
Experience collaborating across cross-functional business units. 
A track record of thriving in high-performing team environments. 

What’s in it for you?

Flexible working options: We know that work is only one part of your life, so we actively encourage a positive work-life balance and provide hybrid working options to help you achieve it.
Office perks: Take advantage of our gym facility and fitness classes, free parking, BBQ area, mini-Coles supermarket, fooderie hub where you can sample new products before they hit the shelves, school holiday program and so much more when you come in.
Discounts: Eligible team members receive 5% discount all year round on your Supermarket and Liquor online and in-store purchases. We also offer additional periods of double discount (10%) at various times throughout the year. As well as hotdeals exclusive to team members that translate into additional savings.
Reward through recognition: Give and receive recognition, linked to our Coles values, through our digital recognition platform ‘mythanks’. You can accumulate points to redeem in the online shop for exciting gifts and electronic gift cards from an extensive range of retailers.
Opportunities for learning and development: No matter where you start within our diverse business, you’ll have experiences, exposure, and education to satisfy you. Discover and explore a variety of career development programs and job-specific training.
Paid parental leave: We understand how important your life outside work is and offer permanent team members paid parental leave to support you in balancing work and family.
Investment in your future: Our annual team member share plan offer allows eligible team members to make regular pre-tax salary sacrifice deductions to purchase Coles Group shares.

About the recruitment process

We’re continuing to build a gender equitable team, and a culture that is just as diverse, inclusive and welcoming as the communities we serve. We are committed to creating a workplace that is safe and respectful for our team. We encourage applications from people of all ages, cultures (including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples), abilities, sexual orientation and gender identities.

We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support candidates with disability. For further information and additional contact details visit the ‘Our Recruitment Process’ section of our careers site or email inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au

Job ID: 169659

Employment Type: Full time

#LI-RM1

About Us

At Sportsbet, we’re united behind our purpose to “Bring Excitement to Life” for our 2 million customers (and growing!). We do this by over-delivering through our commitment to fun, challenging the status quo and living our values. As part of the Flutter Group, we’re a global player, but in Melbourne, Sydney and Darwin we’re a tight knit group of 1,300 teammates (of which over half are in our Tech and Data Science teams!).

We are a significant contributor to the Australian economy through racing and sporting codes and we are committed to having a positive impact in society by supporting our customers, our communities and our employees. Our commitment to responsible gambling is genuine and demonstrated through the wide range of responsible gambling initiatives and tools. 

In 2023, we were a recipient of LinkedIn’s Top 25 Companies for our focus on career development and awarded the Top 10 Workplaces for Women through Work180. Our commitment to making Sportsbet the best place to work is never-ending. 

Sportsbet is Australia’s leading online sports and racing wagering brand — and part of Flutter Entertainment, a FTSE100 and NYSE-listed global powerhouse. We operate in a fast-moving, highly regulated environment where great strategy really matters.

We’re looking for a Senior Strategy Manager to join us. This is a high-impact role for someone who loves solving complex problems, influencing senior leaders, and turning insight into action, all while working in a collaborative, supportive, and ambitious team.

The Opportunity

As a Strategy Manager, you’ll play a hands-on role in shaping Sportsbet’s future. You’ll work closely with our executive leaders, including the CEO, GMs and international Flutter teams, to frame the questions that matter most and deliver strategies that drive real outcomes.

You’ll balance big-picture thinking with practical delivery, bringing structure, clarity and momentum to some of the most important initiatives across the business.

What You’ll Be Doing

Shape the Strategy

Help develop Sportsbet’s long-term company strategy and annual OKRs
Bring fresh thinking and structured problem-solving to our biggest opportunities and challenges

Lead Meaningful Projects

Own the end-to-end delivery of priority strategic projects — from framing and analysis through to recommendations and execution
Combine quantitative analysis with customer, market and qualitative insights to surface what really matters
Translate complexity into clear, compelling narratives that influence decisions

Collaborate & Lead

Work across diverse, cross-functional teams (strategy, analytics, finance, tech, product and more)
Step into an emerging leadership role on projects, building alignment and momentum across the organisation
Partner closely with the Strategy & Research team to deliver work that’s focused, thoughtful and sustainable

About You

Tertiary qualification in business, finance, economics, STEM or similar (MBA is highly valued)
3-5 years of experience in top-tier management consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy and/or a fast based strategic leadership role in a high growth environment
Strong strategic and analytical capability, with confidence working across data, insights and financials to inform decisions
A collaborative influencer who builds trust with stakeholders and drives alignment across diverse teams, including senior leaders
An excellent communicator who can simplify complex problems, tell a compelling story, and turn insight into action
Curious, adaptable and commercially minded, with a genuine interest in tech, direct-to-consumer businesses and/or sports and wagering

The Perks

We work hard and play hard, so along with a competitive salary and generous performance-based bonus, here’s some of our other perks:

25 days annual leave (that’s right, a whole extra week!)
Genuine flexible working policy with a $800 work from home office allowance
Weekly concierge service including free massages, manicure/nail appointments – all onsite
Development budget to send you to conferences, events, courses and other learning opportunities.
End of trip facilities with an onsite table tennis and pool table
Access to our Employee Assistance Program and a Circle In membership
Industry leading Parental Leave support program with 26 weeks paid leave for Primary Carers and no wait time. We also have a progressive return to work benefit for your first 6 months back: come back for 3 days, get paid for 4; come back for 4 days, get paid for 5.

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we review candidates within 2 weeks of advertising. Be sure to check out our Life@Sportsbet Instagram page, Sportsbet LinkedIn page as well our careers website for more information and insight into our culture.

A leading insurer is undertaking a major transformation of its insurance platforms, modernising how broker data is interpreted, decisioned and responded to across underwriting systems.

We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst with strong insurance domain expertise to play a pivotal role in designing and shaping a business rules engine that will centralise complex underwriting logic and significantly improve the broker experience.

The Opportunity

This role sits within a modernisation program replacing multiple legacy platforms. A suite of APIs has already been established, and the focus is now on capturing, rationalising and structuring underwriting logic that currently exists across systems, spreadsheets and manual decisioning.




What You’ll Be Doing

Lead the analysis, definition and documentation of underwriting business rules for SME insurance products

Partner closely with underwriters, product teams and technology delivery squads to extract complex business logic

Help design a centralised business rules engine to interpret broker-submitted data and return clear, contextual outcomes

Translate underwriting decisioning into API-driven rules and workflows

Improve the overall broker experience

Act as a senior bridge between business and technology in a highly data- and logic-driven environment




What You’ll Bring

Essential

Strong insurance industry background, ideally within underwriting or product (not claims-led)

Proven understanding of underwriting language

Extensive experience as a Senior Business Analyst on complex transformation programs

Confidence working directly with underwriters and translating their intent into structured logic

Experience working with APIs, integrations and modern digital platforms

Highly analytical mindset with a focus on decisioning, data and customer outcomes

Nice to Have

Experience working with business rules engines or decision management platforms

SME or commercial insurance exposure

Experience modernising or replacing legacy insurance systems




Why This Role?

Complex, high-impact BA role focused on underwriting logic and decisioning

Opportunity to materially improve broker experience through better context and automation

Greenfield rules capability within a large insurance environment

12-month contract offering stability and depth of engagement




If you’re an insurance-experienced Senior Business Analyst who enjoys turning complex underwriting logic into clear, automated outcomes, we’d love to hear from you.

👉 Apply now or reach out for a confidential discussion.

At Hays Enterprise Solutions, our mission is to help organisations thrive by supporting their workforce needs. We partner with over thirty large organisations across Australia and New Zealand providing tailored solutions to ensure our clients have unrivalled access to top talent and unique market insights to build their evolving workforces.

This is a permanent opportunity within one of Australia's largest automotive financier.

What you'll contribute to
The Product Practice Manager is responsible for defining, developing, and continuously improving the product management practices within an Agile organisation. This role serves as a key enabler for the Domains, and product teams by fostering alignment between business strategy and product delivery through best-in-class agile product management principles.

The Product Practice Manager ensures that product owners and managers are equipped with the right tools, processes, and coaching to drive customer value, be able to prioritise backlogs effectively, and facilitate seamless collaboration across teams and stakeholders. By championing Agile and product principals, this role accelerates value delivery while maintaining a consistent product vision and promoting a culture of agility and continuous improvement

How you'll make an impact
  
Strategic Leadership & Alignment

Define, communicate, and evolve the vision and strategy for the product management practice within the organisation.

Align product management standards, tools, and techniques with enterprise-wide agile transformation goals.

Ensure consistency of product management practices across Domains

Practice Development & Coaching

Lead the development, scaling, and continuous improvement of the product Management practice.

Coach and mentor Product Managers, Product Owners, and Business Analysts

Establish a Community of Practice to support knowledge sharing and skill development.

Tools, Frameworks & Methodology

Standardize product management tools and templates across the organization (e.g. roadmaps, backlogs, OKRs).

Collaborate with the Agile Centre of Excellence team to refine frameworks and tooling support for product practices, which improve and align visibility, traceability and prioritisation processes

Cross-functional Collaboration

Serve as a liaison between business stakeholders, Domain leaders, and technology teams. Promote alignment between Product teams, and stakeholders across the Domains

Partner with Release Train Engineers, Solution Managers, and Architects to ensure alignment of product strategy and system architecture.

Recruitment & Succession Planning

Support recruitment, onboarding, and development of the Product team.

Assess competency gaps and coordinate learning opportunities or coaching plans.

Develop career pathways and succession strategies for product role

Your attributes    

Degree qualification in Business, Technology, Product Management, or a related field

SAFe® certifications strongly preferred

Minimum 5 years of experience in product management, product ownership, or business analysis roles within agile environments.

At least 3–5 years in a leadership or coaching capacity, ideally managing product practices or communities of practice.

Hands-on experience working in a scaled agile environment.

Proven experience implementing or maturing product management frameworks and processes at scale.

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at all levels of the organisation.

Competence in product discovery, customer research, backlog management, and outcome measurement.

Growth mindset: committed to continuous learning and organizational evolution. 

If you feel this role could be a good fit for you, then we would love for you to reach out and apply below!

Don't miss out out on this career defining opportunity in Product Management!

We are looking for a skilled, passionate, and collaborative individual to join a growing global team, one who can incubate a keen interest in technology that ultimately improves patient outcomes.
  
As the Technical Product Analyst, you'll:

· Develop, build, and communicate key health tech products, internal and external.
· Help the product team define products for launch into the telehealth marketspace.
· Work with clinical, technology, operational, and administrative teams to define product requirements.
· Use qualitative and data lead approaches to understanding customers and users use of our platforms, to highlight areas of improvement in those platforms.
· Support the development and implementation of strategic initiatives.
· Develop relationships with the product team, customers, and users
· Facilitate workshops to elicit and document customer and user problems, needs, and workflow.
· Work with the product team and User experience specialists to determine the best approach to solving problems for users.
· Interpretation of lo-fi and hi-fi wireframes.
· Work with development and test automation teams to deliver solutions to customer / user problems, including the documentation of success criteria.
· Create, maintain, and update product information.
· Develop and communicate user and customer definitions for the use of the product and development teams.
· Assist with the management of key vendors and service providers.
· Contribute and work using our development approach which includes User Journeys, Epics, User Stories, Behaviour Driven Development for scenarios, and automated testing.
· Establish and track product success metrics, working with the product and development teams to establish a product roadmap.
· Drafting of process, training, and product documentation.
· Identify change and improvement opportunities across systems, processes, and people capabilities.
  
YOU - 
  
 - Demonstrated experience of technical product management or a technical BA seeking to move into product management, that can produce high-quality metrics / data driven deliverables, and possesses a strong desire for creating value for our company and clients.
 - Strong capability and willingness to pick up and understand new concepts,  regarding maging workflow systems. 

· Market research to understand customer and user needs and communication of them.
· Creation of economic models.
· Development of product roadmaps, based on customers, users, market intelligence, and product team feedback.
· Ability to “sell” product vision and bring others onboard with that vision.
· Data / metrics fluency, including the use of data / metrics applications, e.g. SQL, Redshift, Tableau, TM1, PowerBI, or similar.
· Development, use, and communication of user and customer metrics, e.g. Google Analytics, Pendo.io, Fullstory, Hotjar, or similar
· Strong relationship development skills and ability to build strong, collaborative relationships
· Solid understanding of Agile methodologies applied to project delivery.
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills
· Ability to work and coordinate well within a globally dispersed team or independently.
· Formal Product Analyst qualifications or certifications.
· Experience working in an agile environment as a Scrum Master
· Working knowledge of JIRA and Confluence
· Familiarity with compliance against ISO 27001
  
Cultural Fit:
  
We are passionate about our organisation and our community. Everyone that works here is passionate about creating a best-in-class environment, helping our doctors to save lives. We recognise the criticality of what we do.
  
We collaborate, we communicate, we share knowledge, we build each other up and we support each other. We share in success and failure. People working here are expected to bring their A-Game, but we recognise that the power of an effective team will always deliver more than the capability of any one individual.
  
We support flexible working arrangements, celebrate diversity and we welcome people from all places and all backgrounds.
